H0.text: The third most translated author, which Frenchman, whose birthday is celebrated yesterday, is considered the father of Science Fiction (along with Hugo Gemsback and H.G. Wells) and wrote works such as Around the World in 80 Days and A Journey to the Center of the Earth. Jules Verne

H3.text: The third most translated author, which Frenchman, whose birthday is celebrated yesterday, is considered the father of Science Fiction (along with Hugo Gemsback and H.G. Wells) and wrote works such as Around the World in 80 Days and A Journey to the Center of the Earth. Vernean

A4.text: Jules Verne has been the second most-translated author in the world since 1 getMenuInflater, ranking below Agatha Christie and above William Shakespeare.

A5.text: Jules Verne has sometimes been called the 'father of science fiction', a title that has also been given to H. G. Wells and Hugo Gernsback.
